name: BRIGx
description: Generate publication-quality circular plots comparing bacterial genomes. Upload a reference and query genomes to visualize sequence similarity with interactive, zoomable ring diagrams.

name: MLSTx
description: Type bacterial genomes using MLST schemes directly in your browser. Supports E. coli, Salmonella, S. aureus and more with instant results and CSV export.

name: MashtreeWebx
description: Build quick phylogenetic trees from genome assemblies using Mash distances. Get a neighbor-joining tree in seconds, entirely in your browser.

name: RonaQC
description: Quality control for SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data. Upload BAM files to assess cross-contamination, primer coverage, and consensus quality. Determine if samples are reliable for phylogenetic analysis and public database submission.

name: Specx
description: Identify bacterial species and assess assembly quality directly in the browser. Upload genome assemblies to get rapid taxonomic classification, contamination screening, and completeness metrics — no server required.

name: Genetrax
description: Screen bacterial genomes for antimicrobial resistance genes and virulence factors in your browser. Upload assemblies to detect clinically relevant genetic markers with detailed annotation and exportable reports.

name: pMLSTx
description: Type plasmid replicons using pMLST schemes entirely in the browser. Identify plasmid incompatibility groups and sequence types from bacterial genome assemblies with instant, privacy-preserving analysis.

name: Impressx
description: Run classic EBI-EMBOSS sequence analysis utilities directly in your browser. Access widely-used tools for sequence alignment, restriction analysis, and motif searching — all client-side with no uploads to external servers.
features: Fully client-side, no data leaves your machine

name: Consensusx
description: Convert sequenced reads into high-quality consensus sequences for downstream analyses

name: Socrux
description: Determine the structural genome profile of bacterial chromosomes based on the organisation of ribosomal RNA operons, entirely in the browser. Upload a genome assembly to identify genomic structural (GS) types by mapping rRNA operon positions and inter-operon fragment order.

name: Barrnapx
description: Annotate ribosomal RNA, transfer RNA, and non-coding RNA features in prokaryotic and fungal genomes directly in the browser. Upload a genome assembly to predict RNA coordinates with GFF3 export — a browser-native replacement for barrnap.
features: Fully client-side, no data leaves your machine

name: assembly-statsx
description: Compute N50, GC content, gap counts, and length distributions from FASTA/FASTQ assemblies in your browser. Replicates assembly-stats with interactive visualisations and multi-file comparison.
features: Client-side — no data leaves your browser

name: snp-distsx
tagline: SNP Distance Matrix in Your Browser
description: Browser-based pairwise SNP distance matrix calculator from aligned FASTA files. Faithful TypeScript reimplementation of Torsten Seemann's snp-dists with interactive heatmap, histogram, and table views.
features: Interactive heatmap with colour-coded distance matrix
Distribution histogram with adjustable cluster threshold
TSV, CSV, and long (molten) format export
Client-side processing — no data leaves your browser

name: SNP-Sitesx
description: Extract SNP sites from multi-FASTA alignments in your browser. Outputs VCF, Phylip, and SNP-only FASTA with interactive visualisations of SNP density, nucleotide frequencies, and pairwise distances.
features: Client-side — no data leaves your browser

name: ScagaireX
description: Filter antimicrobial resistance gene predictions by bacterial species in your browser. Upload Abricate, StarAMR, or RGI-CARD output and remove genes not known to occur in the target species — reducing noise from commensal flora.
features: Supports Abricate, StarAMR, and RGI-CARD input formats
Species-specific gene filtering with occurrence threshold
Client-side processing — no data leaves your browser

name: madansix
description: Reorder and reorient fragmented bacterial genome assembly contigs using gene synteny from a pan-genome reference. Upload your assembly FASTA, pan-genome FASTA, and Roary graph — get a scaffolded assembly in your browser.
features: Client-side processing — no data leaves your browser
